author: lightclient
content: Big PR with lot's of basic tests for most defined `eth` methods (skipped some methods related to mining and signing), fixed several small spec issues, added `eth_createAccessList -- PTAL https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/265

author: lightclient
content: will leave up for at least 24 hrs

author: sky.cactus
content: It would be good to know if these have been run against multiple clients or not.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm a bit hesitant about specifying things by "what geth does", especially when what geth doese isn't reasonable (not common, but sometimes this is the case).

author: sky.cactus
content: By running the suite against other clients, we can find out where they differ and then initially PR everything where there is consensus, and discuss items where there isn't.

author: sky.cactus
content: (glancing over these tests, nothing jumps out as "probably going to cause cross client problems")

author: lightclient
content: these tests power the hive test `rpc-compat` so once it is merged will see how other clients fair: https://hivetests2.ethdevops.io/

author: lightclient
content: im having some trouble running hive locally right now, but i expect there to be many failures as the tests verification is pretty rigid (e.g. no extra fields beyond what is specified)

author: lightclient
content: I'm not proposing this is the final form of the spec for these methods, but rather we use this as a tool to continue honing the spec (this is why it is still in alpha)

author: sky.cactus
content: Ah, OK.  If this is just step one towards reconciliation then I support it.  I thought this was proposing to be The Standard.

author: lightclient
content: that comes later, when we move out of alpha
